final_answer.precision_note: 3 significant figures (no decimal places), as bond energies are given as whole numbers

method: Identify bonds broken and formed from the equation CH4 + 2O2 -> CO2 + 2H2O. Bonds broken in reactants: 4 C-H bonds (4 × 413 = 1652 kJ) and 2 O=O bonds (2 × 498 = 996 kJ), total = 2648 kJ. Bonds formed in products: 2 C=O bonds in CO2 (2 × 805 = 1610 kJ) and 4 O-H bonds in 2H2O (4 × 463 = 1852 kJ), total = 3462 kJ. Using deltaH = sum(bonds broken) - sum(bonds formed) = 2648 - 3462 = -814 kJ mol-1. The negative value indicates an exothermic reaction, consistent with combustion.
checks: Exothermic check: combustion reactions are exothermic, deltaH should be negative - verified (-814 kJ mol-1)
Bond count check: CH4 has 4 C-H, 2 O2 has 2 O=O, CO2 has 2 C=O, 2 H2O has 4 O-H - verified
